88397041.review:
I reviewed LoveChoice in a full article on my website for those who are interested:  https://thenewleafjournal.com/lovechoice-review-a-steam-visual-novel/

Below is the reader's digest version of my overall positive review.

LoveChoice is a short but memorable visual novel, and well worth the price. It contains three distinct love stories, each examining a different type of relationship. It takes somewhere in the range of two hours to complete if one is playing it straight through to the end. A couple of out-of-the way achievements add a bit of mileage to the gameplay.

The art and music are both terrific and two of the most memorable aspects of LoveChoice. The story-book look works very well, although I did occasionally have some minor difficulty figuring out all the things I could interact with in a scene. The three stories are well told, and the best choices make sense in the context of what is happening.

The biggest weakness in the English version of the game is that the dialogue often sounds unnatural and wooden. There is never a point where the story or characters do not make sense, but what they say often sounds awkward. To be fair, however, the developers are forthright about the translation process, and the issues are ultimately outweighed by LoveChoice's very reasonable price and all of its merits. With that being said, I hope that it eventually receives a more professional English translation.

It has my recommendation - even at full price LoveChoice is a good way to spend an evening or a weekend.

87047020.review:
[i]El romance puede ser tan confuso e increíble a la vez, un claro ejemplo de esto es el juego Love Choice, toda una experiencia que también es confusa e increíble, terminarás conmovido o frustrado al acabar una partida.[/i]

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
[h1]+Contexto del juego: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Desarrollado y distribuido por Akaba studio, un estudio pequeño que produjo este juego algo corto, ya está concluido, pero por razones legales sigue en “Acceso Anticipado”.
[/list]

[h1]+Historia: [/h1]
[list]
[*]El juego se desarrolla en 3 historias cortas: juego de amor, amor a distancia y amor misterioso.
[*]Juego de amor: dos personas se conocen mientras desarrollan un juego, tu debes vincularlos para tener un buen final, si lo estropeas no lo obtendrás.
[*]Amor a distancia: dos niños se conocen y se hacen amigos poco a poco, la historia juega con el tiempo y tus decisiones afectarán su final.
[*]Amor misterioso: una pareja de esposos está en un romance monótono, debemos hacer algo para que la situación cambie, ¿no?
[/list]

[h1]+Gameplay: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Es una novela visual y un Point and Click, donde en las tres historias debes de encontrar la mejor opción para obtener los diferentes finales.
[*]Las 3 historias varían en su jugabilidad, pero todas tienen que jugarse con Mouse. En ocasiones jugarás unos pequeños minijuegos, pero no son muchos, lo mas importante es las historias románticas.
[*]Es una lastima que el juego no te indique las reglas (usar o no el mouse), pero puedes interactuar con el fondo, esto es importante para sacar los finales buenos. 
[*]Hablemos un poco de la historia, las tres son muy buenas e interesantes, pero no hay ramificaciones para tener mejores finales, solo hay 3 por cada una, algunas son muy restrictivas y te obligan a hacer más acciones para obtenerlas.
[*]El “romance” en el juego toca en diferentes puntos: a veces solo lo superficial y lo que es común en este sentimiento, otras tocan más la sensibilidad del jugador y se avienta buenos giros de trama. Realmente es una montaña rusa de emociones.

[*]Ahora veamos algunos modos de juego:
-Comenzar: aquí veremos las 3 historias, en 2 de ellas podemos elegir el momento donde jugar para poder sacar los finales, pero solo estarán disponibles si ya hemos jugado mínimo una vez.
-Álbum: aquí veremos ilustraciones de las 3 historias dependiendo de cuanto hemos avanzado, podemos guardarlas en los archivos locales del juego, así obtenemos bonitos wallpapers.

[*]Ahora veamos algunos problemas:
-Contenido: no hay ramificaciones, por ende los finales no son muchos, pero son especiales y bien elaborados. Solo son 3 historias, quizá hubiera sido interesante ver algunas más o algún DLC. También puede ser jugar los minijuegos por separado, algunos están buenos.
-Estructura: como ya mencioné, el juego toca de forma superficial el romance, pero a veces si se dan sus vueltas para explicar otro punto de vista al romance, no es constante y varía mucho. Aunque el sentimiento final sigue siendo: “Awwwww”.
[/list]

[h1]+Gráficos: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Es algo simple, pero cuando obtengas una secuencia especial, veremos una gran mejora con unas  ilustraciones muy bonitas. Es minimalista y con colores pastel, pero combina bien con la vibra general
[/list]

[h1]+Música y sonido: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Piano y pequeñas composiciones de este estilo, tranquilas y pasivas para todo el recorrido, lastima que no hay muchas pistas. No hay muchos sonidos, los necesarios para el ambiente.
[/list]

[h1]+Accesibilidad: [/h1]
[list]
[*]Tiene texto en español, con algunos pequeños errores en la traducción, pero nada grave.
[*]Se pude jugar con teclado y mouse, o solo mouse. Se recomienda usar audiófonos para una mejor experiencia. 
[/list]

--------------------------------------------------------------------------
[h1]+En síntesis: [/h1]
[list]
[*]El punto de vista del romance que presenta este juego es lo mas llamativo, las historias varían en calidad pero siempre culminan con la misma sensación de tranquilidad y emoción. No hay mucho contenido, es algo en tener en cuenta antes de comprarlo. Recuerda que es importante el uso de un mouse.
[/list]

83247541.review:
First, I want to say, please take this review with discretion. It's only my humble opinion.

In the beginning, I was so angry about this game: "The girl does not say anything, so I have not much to work with." or "I would do this stuff very different, why do you only give me this options?!" 
I really was about to refund the game.. until I understood how to play it properly. Suddenly discovering how to to go with the options I wanted the whole time.. This made up for a completely different experience.

The best advice this game is giving is: [b]"Relationships should rely on mutual understanding, not changing who you are."[/b]
That means understanding, accepting, listening, working together and growing as a person and team. 

[hr][/hr] 
But a bit of advice: Do never make yourself rely on anyone too much, is it a friend or a partner, as they can break your trust and when they leave, it is possible you break down. 

This game does not teach anyone to find someone you cannot live without, but how to live together and enrich their lives, because they want and not need to! Sometimes this also means letting go, because working together just does not work anymore.

Still, I need to criticize it.. sometimes people can be nervous on their first date and say something, which might kill the mood, but in this case no one has the right to get upset about it. 
Work with it, that is how this person works and do not expect anything. Some people might not behave like you want them to be, but that is the point - No one will be perfect.
If you are unable to work with their personality, then this might be an indicator that he/she is not the "right one" for you. Leave. 

No one should play around/act, of course some people want to impress us, but if we fall in love with someone that only exists in our imagination, we are more than disappointed, once the feelings of first love disappear.

Also, stalking someone on Social Media to get to know them, is a no go. I would not advise it, but that is only my opinion, as it can be helpful to find stuff to talk about. 
But remember: keeping a conversation alive is part of both sides. Ask them about their interests, keep the conversation going. Do not only talk about or do what he/ she wants. 

TELL/ASK people what you want, make a compromise, don't wait for people to guess what you want. Plan together or maybe prepare multiple activities. Do what you BOTH would like to do/see. 

Please, talk to people if you feel unhappy, instead of keeping it in your soul and leave. Like this, no relationship can be saved. [b]Conversation is key.[/b] Ideally face to face. 

Love and a relationship is work, same goes for friendships. [b]Do not take this game, nor what anyone says as a manual, find your own pace and work together, only then it can be good.[/b] Of course there are some certain no gos, but this boundaries, we all need to set for ourselves.

So, I wanted to be positive. This seems like a small project and the price is very low, so I played it trying to bear that in mind.

Look, if you're at a Game Jam and the girl from another team sits alone doing something, it's not cute approaching her like that. You don't know her, you just like her because of her looks. DON'T. DO. THAT. LET HER BE. If she needs help it's fine approaching her to offer your help, but anything else is just a NO-NO.
Then, right after the event, the player contacts her over weChat without having asked her in advance if that was okay. Stalking 101.
Then right after: Why the only person the player follows on Twitter is her? Stalking 102. And why if she's sad you offer to meet up with her right away? Do you think that's what you should do?? Possessive behaviour 101.

So. Cringe.

Actual quote found in the game: "I lost the game jam but since I could speak with a girl, my colleagues told me I was already a winner. And they were right tbh I am a lucky person".
81831585.developer_response:
HI,

The game asks players to try to understand the character's feelings and try to think out of the box, which barely is asked in other VNs.
I have to point out that somethings in your review was so not true:

2. the player was looking at the girls' tweets not means he only follows the girl. That happens when you look at anyone's page.

If you still want to try the game, please be patient. You won't know what the message is until you figure out the real game mechanics.
If you already lost your patience. It's okay. I still hope you can find the games you like.

Greetings,
Ye@AkabaStudio

Un viaje simple pero profundamente emocional a través de una relación de pareja que podemos iniciar de tres modos: amor-juego, amor-distancia, y amor-detective. 

En cada modo que decidamos iniciar habrá una serie de escenas con objetos con los que podremos interactuar, pudiendo descubrir cosas en común y por compartir, pero también eligiendo una mejor respuesta para las diferencias que vayan surgiendo. Dependiendo de nuestro curiosidad y de nuestras elecciones de diálogos, obtendremos un final u otro en cada uno de los tres modos en que se puede iniciar el juego. 

La música puede ser muy melancólica o alegre. El diseño artístico minimalista y directo es agradable. Una especie de minijuegos con reflejos dan cierta variedad a una jugabilidad hecha de puro click. Sólo se puede jugar en la resolución de 1080p. 

Muy recomendable. Recuerda a juegos como Florence.

75355663.review:
Sometimes sad, sometimes adorable, sometimes confusing,[i] just like love itself [/i], game with great arts and sweet soundtrack.

[h1]LoveChoice[/h1]

First of all, this game is not just any other game which you can play whenever you'd like. To really feel the mood of the game you should log out from all your social networks, keep for later all your usual workday routine and hide from the others on your closet with your laptop. Put your headphones on and read aloud like all that is happening to your character is really happening to you. 

The game has 3 separate stories: Love:Game, Love:Distance and Love:Detective.
First story is about a couple which has met at the game development convent. Game describe the events like first meeting, getting closer to each other, first date, first disagreement, life together and so on. 
Throughout this episode you would have solve true mysteries like "What to watch on your first date", "What to say, when your opponent is upset about something" and others. At the end you will get a letter from your girlfriend which will tell you how good was your relationship and you will get one of two endings.

Second story is about a boy and a girl who met as a really young kids. And gosh, your relationship could never be more complicated then that. Throughout the whole story there will be more and more obstacles to overcome which is really hard to deal with even sitting in front of a monitor. 

And the last story is about a married couple where you, as a wife, beginning to feel that your relationship is becoming more distant then is ever were. Futhermore, you think that your husband is cheating on you. And when he will go to work you will become a real detective to understand what is really going on.

75164559.review:
[h1][i]There's always another story. There's more than meets the eye. - W.H. Auden[/i][/h1]

LoveChoice may be a short visual novel however the stories and interactive choices it provides are beyond than what they are visibly appear. Beyond the adorable and minimalistic illustrations, the message of this game that they are trying to relay is deeper than we thought.

Rather than saying it is thought-provoking, I personally see it as a great game that reminds the players to reflect upon our daily interactions and habits which we may taken for granted from and with our loves one.
 
[spoiler]I personally think that the stories in LoveChoice portray very well on how in this contemporary society and century, there are countless of times we may be too focus into our jobs and careers which we lost sights of how we usually interacting with our loves one. [i]Sure, we are doing the jobs to pay the bills, but that does not give us any right to neglect their emotions and feeling either.[/i] What they need most of the time, is not just a shelter on their heads, foods on their tables - but an emotional support; the reliable feeling and sense of secure and trust that allows our loves one to be at ease wholeheartedly.[/spoiler]

Some may think that this game is like testing their morality regarding how they will approach to the situations in relationship. However, with a right and firm mind, you will see how the stories in this game is actually reminding and enriching our views and opinions towards the value of life and relationship given in the various of situations and the interactive choices that we choose.

Rather than passing by this game, I sincerely hope everyone to give this game a try. It is truly a very beautiful masterpiece to experience. An absolutely fulfilling and worthy gameplay. This game is definitely one of a kind.

71150496.review:
LoveChoice is a game with three different storylines, each with their own sets of choices and endings, with a price of roughly $1.99 USD as of the time of writing this, not including additional content.

And to be honest? I wouldn't argue if they bumped that up to $4.99 or so. It's worth it.

Not quite enough content to be worth $10, but definitely more than $2 or so.

LoveChoice is a sweet and charming game created and produced by a small Chinese developer with a limited team and limited resources. Nonetheless, it's clever, adorable, and touched my heart. The choices don't always make sense, and some are rather difficult to figure out in order to get the endings you wants, but if you don't, please don't get discouraged! And while the English translation may be a bit below-grade, it doesn't detract from the story or make it difficult to understand. All-in-all, it's a very cute little game, and well worth the money, especially for a cheaper game like this. I absolutely adored it, and if you like cute romance indie games for a low, low price, then you probably will too!

Also, the music was great. :3

70791832.review:
Pretty bad and barebones. Florence did this much better. Don't waste your time.

Revision:

Alright so I gave it a second chance after seeing the developer's response to this review.

My opinion hasn't changed. 
First of all, the first big mistake here is that this is a love game and I shouldn't be looking for hidden ways to progress. It kills the flow of the gameplay and it's sometimes unnecessarily difficult to find the alternative answer.

The big elephant in the room, however, is how AWKWARD these dialogue options are. They don't get any better once you find the "correct" answer. There's barely any character development so most of the times I don't care about either two and I feel that I don't have to work at all for them to "fall in love". Therefore, I'm just presented with a relationship that starts and ends in a matter of a couple of screens. If that's appealing to you, well, maybe this game will please you.
70791832.developer_response:
Hi, sorry for your bad experience.

Unlike Florence, this game needs players to figure out its trick on their own. If one doesn't get the point of it. It will be very boring and meaningless. 

Here are some tips for your better experience.
1. Tons of hints are in the texts.
2. If you feel none of the given options is right. Maybe you are right.
3. Please think of the box.

I am a freshman in the industry. I don't think our game is better than Florence. But I personally love Florence and I do sure you will like our game after you know the trick, especially when you like Florence as well.

Thanks!

68833700.review: This game is a dating sim. For a dating sim to work, you need to have likable characters. That being said, the protagonist is pretty unlikable, with all of his responses to his love interest being either dismissive or completely unrelated to the conversation being had. The love interest doesn't really have a personality or even a name (neither does the main character), which makes it difficult to get attached to her. [spoiler]The only ending I could get was the two breaking up and it doesn't make you feel anything because you don't know or care about the characters. I'm honestly not sure if there are any other endings, because no choices seem to have any impact on the story.[/spoiler] The game takes place over the course of three years, but can takes at most 15 minutes. Making choices gives no indication on whether or not the story changes, as they all result in the same dialogue. The dialogue in general doesn't make much sense a lot of the time. You'll have one character say one thing and then the other (or sometimes even the same character) say something completely unrelated, which makes everything feel very unnatural. Overall, I'd say there're definitely better options out there, but the game is only $2, so if you wanna try it, go for it. Plus, the art's cute.
68833700.developer_response:
Hi, Thanks for playing and sorry for the bad experience you had.
First of all, this game is not a dating sim. If you just take it as a dating sim, you probably never get the other endings but the break-up one. The characters don't have their names for a reason, and they sometimes say exactly the same sentences for a reason as well, but I can't tell you the reason unless you get the other endings, or it will spoil everything.

Here are some hints that I think will help you have a better experience.

1. If you think none of the options is right. Maybe you are right.
2. Please think out of the box.
3. There is tons of hint hidden in the texts. If you treat the girl like a person, not a likable character. You may figure out what she is thinking.
4. Not only options in this game.

This game will surprise you if you give it more time. 
But if you already lost interest in it, it's okay, I hope you will find games that you like.

65854475.review:
LoveChoice simply put is a game that is able to grab the heart of its audience and really feel every word that is told on screen. At first, I was a bit skeptical of LoveChoice with it's short run time and "Overwhemingly Positive" review status. I still bought it because as they say, you can refund it if you are not satisfied.

I did not refund it. I was beyond satisfied.

The art and soundtrack of the game is what holds this game together. The cute and simple art style manages to reinforce that feeling of wholesomeness that is present throughout all the stories. I personally think that this art style was the best way of portraying the story as I was more invested by the cutesy vibe of it all. The soundtrack accompanies the entire game with nice mellow piano and memorable melodies for certain moments.

The gameplay....well it is a visual novel, so this isn't something that I should heavily criticize on. My only criticism here is that I personally think the mini-games are unnecessary. It feels like they are there to pad the time and are there for the sake of this. I'm talking about the first story with its mini-game as I was really annoyed by it every time after the first.

I'm not sure if this counts as gameplay but this is where the game truly shows its excellence. This was when I decided to make a review. The game is very clever and deceiving with its choices. You are forced to think outside the box to get the endings you want. The moment you realizes that there is more to this game than meets the eye, you will captured by it and will never let go. The way they implement this simple trick matches so well with the theme of love. When it comes to love, sometimes we think we only have a certain number of paths we can go to but in reality, sometimes we should make our own path despite what path is being shown. It is amazing for this reason alone.

Please play this game. You won't be disappointed.

65207996.review:
[h1] Love Choice es un recopilatorio de tiernas historias que no te dejarán indiferente [/h1]

Estoy llorando como una magdalena tras haberme acabado dos de las tres historias que componen el juego por ahora.
Love Choice es una novela visual que si bien parece ligerita e infantil por su estilo artístico simple, consigue hacerte llegar la ternura de la historia que te cuenta, con un sobresaliente en ingenio e interactividad del jugador con el entorno. No soy mucho de jugar juegos que únicamente te hacen pulsar diálogos así que esto es un plus enorme.

Dejando de lado el hecho de que la traducción al español cojea en algunos momentos puntuales, se nota el gran esfuerzo de los creadores por llegar a más público y es algo que hay que reconocer y animar a que más desarrolladores que puedan permitírselo lo hagan.

Volviendo al punto con el que he empezado esta reseña, por ahora el juego cuenta con tres historias independientes, cada una de las cuales para obtener todos los finales y logros te hará estar cerca de 40 minutos... ¡pero qué 40 minutos!

Sinceramente, si os sobran dos euros ya estáis tardando en darles todo vuestro dinero a este pequeño equipito indie. Un genial trabajo y despliegue de dulzura convierten a este juego fácilmente en la mejor novela visual que he jugado en mucho tiempo.

The game's descriptions says that this game will give you an answer to love. However, after playing this game I found that not to be true as love in reality is different than how this game shows.

The game as a fantasy is fun and enjoyable, the music is warm and the game is touching. If you buy this game because you want a love simulation you will be disappointed as its not realistic. However, if you come to this game wanting 3 really cute stories ( some short some long) you will enjoy your 2 hours.

The reason i am giving this a bad review is because of the description of the game I had expectations different to what was given in the game. The game is fun, music is good,story is touching, but due to the description I thought i would be presented with realistic love stories than fantasy love stories which this game delivered. I wish I could give this game a mixed review, but unfortunately I can't.

tl;dr: If you expect realistic love stories you will be disappointed, if you want 3 fictional love stories to warm your heart you will be pleased.

60845264.review:
This was really cute and touching. The music is good, the art design is really simple but cute. Each story, and each ending is well done and worth reading. I don't want to talk too much about it as it's better left experienced.

There are some translations/grammatical errors for English in a few places, but it's easily overlooked as you get the gist of it anyway. There are three different stories, each with their own gameplay gimmicks. The first has this minigame which can be tedious if you're going for everything as if you don't get 11/11 of the things you have to re-try. The problem with that is you have to wait for the entire minigame to end before being able to retry it which gets tedious. Most of my time was waiting for that minigame to end so I could retry [I wasn't sure if it actually carried over a 11/11 or not, since when I chose to skip it the second playthrough the ending said I didn't do any planning. Despite having gotten 11/11 my first playthrough...]  

Otherwise it's fun, it's just clicking on a thing that shows up an not hitting the bad ones. Eventually it hides one under a hat and shuffles it around to find, those are always fun to me. And the last one has you needing to follow two hats with pop ups to distract you. The third has a short  match three minigame in it which is cute.

The only other criticism I have of the game is it doesn't convey what you are allowed to do as a player so without a guide or just trying everything out of the sake of it, you might miss how to do some things. I tried to wait at one point, but nothing seemed to happen so I just assumed I couldn't wait. But you can. Some games you have to do certain things so when a game doesn't require that it's nice to know there's more freedom so you don't find yourself confused.

60274585.review:
This game has truly been a pleasant surprise for me. It is simple in it narrative structures yet I couldn't call it shallow. It approaches relationships realistically without being dark, depressing and toxic. I really love how it manages to capture, both, the sweetness and difficulty of ordinary relationships -- making the game endearing, engaging and relatable (to me, at least). I'll admit that I was skeptical of the praise after my first, surface, playthrough. But once I realized that there were so many little things to find that completely change the narrative, I was hooked!

Performance-wise I haven't encountered any  bugs or crashes (for those concerned about it being an early access game.) The English for the Love Detective story could use a bit of smoothing out, but it's nothing that makes the scenario unintelligible. 

I sincerely hope that the devs are not finished with this game and that we will see more like this from them in the future.  This game is very clearly a labor of love and it's been beautifully executed.

58238685.review:
LoveChoice is a collection of, at the time of writing, three short stories that resolve around the topics love and relationships. The stories vary in their length with a reading time of 10 to 30 minutes for each story. This surely isn't much length-wise but it's surely enough to leave an striking impression behind.

When I played the first story for the first time I just thought it's just a run-of-the-mill Visual Novel with dialog-based choices that determine which ending you will get. After a few minutes I reached my first ending and thought "Well, it's probably a normal ending" and I was quite shocked when I read the letter with all sentences being red and getting the message that the couple split up.
In the second run I decided to take the other options and still got a bad ending. Just why?!? There aren't any other options, or are they? In my third run I noticed that there's more than just the dialog choices as there's other ways to interact with the couple and the environment in nearly all scenes which can change the outcome. And this is probably the part where this collection of stories really begins to shine.
Instead of presenting you just one dialog box after another with a few choices in between, you also get some basic gameplay of point-and-click-adventures. After getting the hang of it most of those interactions are easy to assume, but there are still some which aren't that intuitive. One example is a scene where you have to scroll the mouse wheel to see more dialog-options. There wasn't any kind of visual hint for this possibility and I guess most will either stumble over this by accident or by looking up a guide (for me it was the latter option). Nonetheless this is only a small flaw and you will get the hang of the possible interactions in a follow-up run.

About the stories themselves:
I don't want to spoil much about them as it's best to experience them with as few knowledge as possible. All I will say is that it's a nice change of pace from all "standard VNs" as the couples are presented in a grounded way and you will most likely feel familiar with some of their traits. Personally I felt reminded of myself more than one time. And they surely show you that it's not only the words that matter but also the actions, but even if you give your best you might not get the best outcome and have to accept fate.

Presentation-wise LoveChoice is quite minimalistic but still nice to look at with a mix of crayola- and pastel-like CG-scenes. Personally I enjoyed the main theme but otherwise I have to say that I barely noticed the music, but I have to say that is barely a thing I notice while reading a VN.

Overall I would recommend this to anyone that's slightly interested in stories about love and relationships and wants something with a grounded story. It might help you to see things from a new perspective.

55450587.review:
I've only ever given one Chinese visual novel a chance before this, and while I can't say I had a bad experience, I couldn't bring myself to finish it all. It was too long and the gameplay loop too tedious to make it worthwhile. Here, after only eighty minutes of playtime (as of this review), is an experience that truly surprised me.

LoveChoice is an anthology of short stories revolving around what it means to love. At the time of this review, there are only three stories available, with the promise of more to come. I will review them individually, recounting my experiences with each of them.

GAME:
This is the most straightforward of the three stories, presenting itself as a typical visual novel with some cutesy art up front. I followed my gut instinct during my first reading; like many people who reviewed this game, I ended up with a bad ending. I couldn't unlock the second story without getting one more ending, so I tried choices I hadn't done. For some reason, it didn't work. It might've been by accident or something, but I realized that the game was telling me something. I was going through the motions, blindly picking choices as if I were brute-forcing myself to a good ending. It works for most VNs, but not this one. I won't spoil what it is you have to do to get the good ending, but I was frankly surprised at how I had to think outside the box.

DISTANCE:
I can see why they had to lock DISTANCE behind GAME, because DISTANCE expects you to have gotten the good ending in GAME. It will test your knowledge of the new mechanics and bend your mind and heart trying to get this couple together. You don't really have to do anything special beyond that, but you'll feel as involved in the relationship of these new characters as the ones in GAME. Things get a bit deep here; the characters feel quite human in the decisions they make.

DETECTIVE:
I wasn't sure what this story would do to shake up the gameplay, or even what story angle it would explore. These stories are all quite simple when you look at them, but there's beauty in their simplicity. This story follows a married woman who suspects her husband is cheating on her with another woman. The game pretty much turns into a point-and-click adventure as you scour the house for clues pointing toward the husband's infidelity. The outcome (again, without spoiling) was quite unexpected, and it fit quite well with the general tone of these stories.

From these three stories alone, I have high hopes for the remainder that are being written. On top of that, the presentation of each story is fantastic, from the art to the music to (in some respects) the dialogue. I admit that the translation does have its problems (I ended up catching a line that went completely untranslated in GAME), but I understood enough to follow along with the story. Also, minor complaint, but I wish this game had a 'skip read text' button. :P

Bottom line: it's cute, and a breath of fresh air. I'd even go so far as to say that this is what Doki Doki Literature Club should have been. Looking forward to the rest of the stories! :D

55119078.review:
[h1][b]A cute & heartwarming story game about love relationships (｡ ･ ∀ ･) ﾉ ﾞ[/b][/h1]
[b]+ Ponit : See nyanco's walkthrough guide video to get the best ending (ง •̀ω•́)ง✧[/b]

[h1][b][1] Intro [/b][/h1]
LoveChoice 拣爱. This is a heartwarming visual novel made by Akaba Studio. One of my followers recommended me to play this game. It is definitely a good game for those who are emotional and mild. The narrative flow is somewhat artificial, but it is a good representation of what the developer wants to say in the game. LoveChoice 拣爱 is currently in early access and there are 3 stories to access.

[h1][b][2] Game Experience[/b][/h1]

The game genre of LoveChoice 拣爱 is visual novel and its game engine is unity player. Indie developers use Ren'Py the most in their genres, but more recently they are using the unity engine. Perhaps for a variety of reasons, the Unity engine certainly has some advantages in the VN genre. This game is one such example. This game has some interesting functions that can be interacted with in addition to text.

For example, like a point-and-click game, it contains hidden messages in the background or props. It is somewhat fresh and makes the storytelling game even more interesting. As well as mini games are included, it affects the story route. The game is generally mild and relaxed, but often displays interactive, dynamic screens such as social media. Such game design was impressive.

Regarding the story, it has meaningful messages about the relationship. There is no right answer for love and relationships. This is just his/her view of the love from this developer has given to the player. Honestly, the story is rather short and the story flow is sudden. But that's enough to convey the theme of the game to the player. The story is sweet, the characters are cute and emotional. We experience it through the game. And it will definitely be a valuable experience.

48625799.review:
[h1]💌 𝐿𝑜𝓋𝑒𝒞𝒽𝑜𝒾𝒸𝑒 拣爱 💌[/h1]

What's more sought after than a sequel to Half-Life 2, but rarer than a 21ᵗʰ century bug-free Bethesda release? It's, of course, a gamer girlfriend — the one thing that male gamers desperately want but can't seem to get. All jokes asides, LoveChoice 拣爱 is a short but sweet title starring a boy and a girl both who have a deep passion for making video games, as well as for each other. In this interactive story-telling game, you'll be playing as the boy in his determined endeavor to make the right love choices in his life. LoveChoice — the most unusual way to hunt for restaurants and darn onion cutting ninjas.

The story starts off at a game jam where the player, along with the rest of the other indie developers, is attentively working on game concept ideas. During the jam, he happens upon a girl nearby his group's table. He approaches her and they begin a casual chat, and thus, they set off on their new relationship. 

Along the way, you'll be met with a few challenges such as figuring out what movie she wants to watch or playing a curious minigame to find some decent places to eat. These tasks, as Ye from Akaba Studio put it, are supposed to show how,

    " you should put more effort in and do more preparation for your dating."

It's a great message to those who are in a relationship to always understand that  "loving your partner" isn't always a cakewalk. It's quite important to put some day to day effort in making your lover feel genuinely special to you.

LoveChoice's art style has a definite charm to it with an innocent and almost childlike presentation. Both the girl and boy have a distinct, warm delight to their character complexion to complement their adorable appearance. It's quite a contrast from most visual novels in today's market where the characters have jumbo eyes and generous body proportions and features. The minimalistic style of LoveChoice gives me a desire to see more of this kind of artwork in storytelling. Additionally, the music is superbly outstanding — using soft and gentle soundtracks to effectively support each of the story's scenes. 

[b]Spoiler Alert![/b]
This next part contains light spoilers, so I encourage those who've yet to play the game to skip on past. 

After playing the game through a couple times I always ended up confused and bewildered as to why I didn't get an ending that satisfied me. Each playthrough had left me more puzzled than the last. Which choice was I getting wrong? Did I miss some sort of secret choice within the dialogue options? That's when it hit me like a sledgehammer on a bag of Jet-puffed marshmallows. What if the girl didn't want me to choose the dialogue options? What if there was a deeper, more hidden love choice? This is where things took a rather emotional turn for me. It's difficult to explain what a surprising eye-opener it was to finally realize what LoveChoice was truly trying to tell me. All along, the girl wanted me not to just "say," but to "care and do." She wanted me to consider her true heart's desire, even though she didn't explicitly mention it to me. From then onward, I began to diligently search of ways that I could make true love choices for the girl I cared for — and it was absolutely beautiful. Finally reaching the ending I so desired was certainly a joyful experience. According to LoveChoice's main designer Ye,

    "I think the "hidden choice" like some answers just don't come up in your mind default in real life. They are usually of our comfort zone and need our thinking. Human tends to forget this kind of options,  especially when it was to ones close to us. I am not saying the default  options are bad or wrong, I just want to say the one we truly love  always deserve a better answer."

LoveChoice obviously isn't an AAA budget title, nor is a fully fledged indie game. But I can say without a doubt, it gave me a more heartfelt experience than any game I've played in a long time. It compelled me to deeply think and consider my own current relationship along with the "love choices" I should look to make. Although I may not be able to guarantee the next person who plays LoveChoice, a touching and moving experience — it is definitely a precious story that deserves to be heard by all. Sometimes, we need don't a whole 20+ hours of playtime to get a decent gaming experience. Sometimes, all it takes is a short message and a developer's effort to create a game from the heart. Thank you, Akaba Studio, for making such the game I didn't know I needed in my life. I hope that the next stories released in LoveChoice will be just as a heartwarming experience.

45154786.review:
At first, I wasn't too impressed, I felt a bit confused and a bit frustrated at the bad ending after another bad ending. But it didn't take me too long to figure out what I was doing wrong, and I honestly felt so impressed after that. It is such a clever little game, that really hits you in the feelings, because you learn what you were doing wrong the entire time. (I felt so guilty afterwards!) However, once you figure everything out, you will get a beautiful happy ending.
I highly recommend this game, especially if you enjoy a short game with a touching story to it.

Pros:
- Adorable artstyle
- Beautiful story (that is potentially relatable)
- Nice music
- Cute achievements that are easy to get
- Unique visual novel over all

Cons:
- The English isn't amazing at some points. (But it is still good!)
- The mini-game is a little frustrating.
- My game glitched a little at one point. (But I fixed the problem by just pressing escape.)

Overall, as a visual novel lover, and a romantic story fanatic, I would give this sweet story an 8/10!

45148272.review:
This was a really cute, fun game, albeit short.  Which is fine, it didn't really need to be long for it to make its point for me.  I found myself thinking about it for a bit after the game concluded (i'm a romantic, what can i say?!).  I found the presentation and execution of the message to be pretty clever and engaging.

I played through the first time not realizing at all that I could interact with the scenery, once I found that I could it did enhance the experience.  My only very minor spot of grief was a part that [spoiler] involves a mouse movement to advance the characters level of intimacy, that didn't feel intuitive or in line with the idea of the player paying attention (the wheel scroll).  [/spoiler] But again that was really really minor. 

One could argue that the relationship themes presented are simplistic, but I would also recognize that simple things do still matter.  I felt the themes could be applied to both romantic and platonic relationships.  We all want a friend or partner who pays attention to our interests, listens, someone we can connect with.  At times people trivialize these themes in all sorts of relationships, even through adulthood (I myself can be guilty of this!).  I found the game to be a cute little reminder of the little things that can matter a lot.

Overall I'd recommend the game and am looking forward to future stories.

45146058.review:
[u][b]A brief review based on first impressions. A complete one will follow up soon.[/b][/u]

If you looking for a beautiful and touching love story, you should check this one game asap.
Believe me on this one, you won't be disappointed.

A big story starts from a friendly conversation on gamedev con, and you'll be given choices as it unfurls, as well as some kind of "hints" regarding to what to do or what to say. But it's not only about the dialogs, I was amazed that sometimes you'll need to look for clues or "active points" right inside of... action area, where our heroes are in the game's window. [b]Please, do not use guides or walkthroughs, just try and find solutions by yourself. It's not too hard, and satisfaction is guaranteed.[/b] 

Depending on your choices, this story might have a bad ending, a good ending, or a perfect ending. Nice thing is that you'll be told where you did a bad choice, and if you know approximately where was that time in the game, you can start the story again and try harder to find a better solution.

The game is quite short, a full playthrough will take you approximately 20-25 minutes. I completed the story multiple times and get all the achievements that are currently available in 118 minutes [spoiler], so, technically, I'm still eligible to refund the game, but there's no way I'll do that.[/spoiler]. Plus there are a great chances that more content will be added.

Beautiful and sweet love story
Nice gameplay.
Touching soundtrack.

And all this - for more than a humble price.

Get it now. Thank me later.

A word for Linux players: I was able to launch and play this game on Linux via proton, but couldn't get a perfect ending - at some point it just stop advancing through the dialogue... and one of achievements doesn't open properly. I was able to get a perfect ending and open all the achievements on Windows. Developer told me that there [b]might be[/b] Linux version in the future, so let's just wait.

45069864.review:
The art style is very cute but the writing makes little sense. Even ignoring the awkward translation.


Less then five minutes in, the main characters are already dating. So their relationship has all the depth of a puddle. And then within twenty minutes of that, you are already at the final confrontation of whether they stay together or not. Everything in between is just stock relationship subjects like talking and arguing; which are glanced over without the player learning anything about either character. The player makes vague dialogue choices which determine what happens to the relationship, but the dialogue choices have no clear behavioural alignment so the result you get is pretty much random. Especially when the first choice has you outright ask the girl you have never met to be your friend, or outright ask if she wants to hear you rant about your teams game concept; in the middle of a competition about said game concept when the girl is your opponent. Neither of which is socially appropriate, but apparently the game still labels one as positive and one as negative.

It really does not feel like whoever wrote this had any idea as to what they were doing. There is no pacing or depth to this "relationship" simulation at all. The player learns almost nothing about either character through the entire course of the plot, the characters are just relationship dolls. They do not even have names. 

It displays highly surface level understanding of what a relationship is like, and lists exclusively stock "relationship" struggles and interactions as the entirety of the plot.


This does however serve as a marvelous example of how superficial average human relationships are. Built on visual and chemical attraction completely void of any level of personal understanding or friendship. Glass partnerships entirely dependent on the two parties serving their designated gender roles and adhering to societal normalcy. The connection held together by the baseless yet intense feeling of "love" which keeps both sides fiercely attached to each other without any level of personal intimacy. If at any moment either side stops playing by the chemical encoded rules, the relationship immediately shatters and then they move on to remate with a new partner a few months or a year later and try it all over again. A system entirely designed to serve one ethical purpose, reproduction, and nothing else. So, this plot.

Yes it did make me sad, but mostly because it reminded me of how shallow humanity is. This is the opposite of what I am looking to experience in fiction, I'm trying to escape from reality not be reminded of it.



The developer thinks I feel bad because I got the bad ending, when all the problems I cite with this plot are about the plot itself and not the ending. Way to try to dismiss my entire point by point dynamic criticism, with a single delusive excuse. Just like how the developer thinks that "paying more attention" will get you the better ending, in a game where all the ways you influence the ending are unmarked neutral dialogue options which have zero positive or negative qualities to them so it is physically impossible to tell what the game is interpreting as good or bad because the dialogue options are either both bad or both neutral.

At least they did not throw a tantrum, like I have seen other developers pull, but they are still just as in denial as literally every developer that bothers to respond to my negative reviews.

45043260.review:
This cute interactive visual novel is very refreshing. The story about love and relationship. We have two characters, a young man who is a game designer, and a young woman who is a designer too. They met in an event and it is your task to approach the girl right. Each choice will affect the relationship, the way you speak with her, interact and even the movie you pick to watch in your first date. Not to forget that you'll have to find a 5 stars restaurant to eat in with a cute mini-game. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1527739231

When you finish a play through the girlfriend either break up with you or stay, depends on how you've been treating her. The last message she gives you is a hint of how things should have gone, you can reply the game over and over to get the perfect relationship which I eventually did as I realized this game is not just a visual novel with choices, but an 'interactive' game. You interact with everything around your 'or not' to get things right, for example when you argue with her, it is better not to say anything. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1527756752

I liked the cute artwork, the characters design and the color choice of the game is really nice. The music is fitting and gives a nice atmosphere for the game. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1527739590

Pros:
+Cute artwork. (You can get all the backgrounds from the extra section)
+Cute story about relationships.
+Choices and consequences.
+Nice soundtracks. 
+Steam achievements.

Cons:
-Quite short, depends on how fast you are to get the perfect relationship.
-No Manuel save.

I do recommend this cute short game, it is very refreshing and has 3 endings. If you enjoy visual novels and games with many choices and consequences, then pick this up.
